headlines.title: World Leaders Compete in Global 'Dance-Off for Peace'; Kim Jong-un Takes First Place with 'Gangnam Style'
headlines.summary: In the most anticipated event of the century, world leaders took the dance floor to strut their stuff instead of their military might. North Korean supreme leader, Kim Jong-un, surprised the audience with his nimble footwork and flawless rendition of 'Gangnam Style', taking home the much-coveted gold disco ball trophy.
headlines.author: Jingle Jangle

headlines.title: Microsoft Discovers an Actual Window in Windows 10
headlines.summary: In a totally unexpected glitch, users of Windows 10 report suddenly seeing an actual window within their computer screens. Software engineers at Microsoft are scrambling to fix this unearthly bug and are, in the meantime, advising users not to try throwing anything out of the digital window.
headlines.author: Gerald Pixel

headlines.title: Amazon Buys Entire Rainforest to Expand 1-day Delivery
headlines.summary: In its latest move to dominate global commerce, Amazon has acquired the entire Amazon rainforest. This bold acquisition aims to remove all logistical bottlenecks and ensure 1-day delivery all over the globe while redefining the concept of a 'jungle marketplace'.
headlines.author: Benjamin Buck

headlines.title: Artificial Intelligence Writes Its First Broadway Musical: 'Algorithm and Blues'
headlines.summary: Taking the world of performing arts by storm, the first Artificial Intelligence has composed a Broadway musical. 'Algorithm and Blues' is a moving tale of a lonely algorithm searching for meaning in a world of ones and zeros.
headlines.author: Penelope Playwright

headlines.title: Man Sues Personal Fitness Tracker for Defamation
headlines.summary: A man from Austin, Texas has filed a lawsuit against his personal fitness tracker, accusing it of defamation. He claims that the device is intentionally under-reporting his steps to make him look lazy.
headlines.author: Skip Runner

weather: Today's weather forecast: Expect intermittent showers of laughter with patches of giggles moving across the region. Occasional gusts of wit may blow away rational thoughts. Humidity levels will be such that your funny bone might get damp.

letterFromCitizen.name: Edgar Everyman
letterFromCitizen.letter: Dear Journal, I woke up today to the sound of my dog meowing. Strange, I thought, but then I remembered I now live in a world where the most powerful leaders shake a leg to resolve conflicts, and Amazon literally owns the Amazon. I shrugged and turned on my computer, only to find my desktop replaced by a panoramic view of the outside world. I then tried to check my steps on my fitness tracker, but to my surprise, it was subpoenaed for a court hearing. As I write this, I can hear the AI next door humming a tune from its latest Broadway hit, 'Algorithm and Blues'. The world is indeed a stage, and everyone—including algorithms—seems to have their parts to play. Yours in absurdity, Edgar.
